text: - My name is Daryl Hammett.

I've been with AWS for
about 18 months now.

My career prior to AWS
was very interesting.
I spent some time in the Navy,

and then I began working
through operations

and working through a
general manager type of role.
And when I retired from there,

I invested in a startup
and I sold that startup

after about 10 years
ago and then recruited

by AWS to come and do
some fun, cool stuff here.
One of the greatest things
about being an entrepreneur is being

in an environment that encourages
you to be entrepreneurial.

And the entrepreneurial
spirit is something
that you cannot push down or you suppress.
So one day I thought of the idea of,

what if we could get together
all the black leaders

at AWS and Amazon together
for a leadership retreat?

So our wrote a paper,
which we do a lot here,

which is the way we
present all of our ideas,
and this is turning out to be phenomenal.

The first thing I would tell
anybody that applies for AWS

it is not like any other company
you have ever worked for,

but if you are committed
to learning every day,
you're committed to the day one culture,

then you're signing up for
the right organization.
Because I don't think

that the typical corporate
employee will actually

be the best type of employee
for our peculiar culture.

Our peculiar culture
gets the best out of you.
I've worked harder here
than I've worked at any other job.
But is it enjoyable work?
I love working here.

Here's the thing that I
cannot talk enough about.

I have some of the greatest
people that work with me.

I have some of the smartest
people that work with me.
They make me better.
If you're willing to be authentic,
allow this culture to work with you,
guide you, shape you, mold you,

this could be one of the
best places you ever work
and could be your last job.
(upbeat music)
